Amreg channel, register

Set Hardcol bitmap1, bitmap2
Set hardware register for hardware Sprite collision detection. This instruction has This instruction has effect in AOZ.

Set Hardcol
Return collision status after a Set Hardcol instruction. Returns 0 in AOZ.

AReg register
variable

Copper On
Re-start automatic copper generation. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Copper Off
Stop automatic copper generation. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Cop Swap
Swap logical and physical copper lists. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Cop Reset
Re-set copper list pointer. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Cop Wait
Insert a WAIT instruction into copper list. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Cop Movel
Write a long MOVE instruction to copper list. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Cop Move
Write a MOVE instruction to current copper list. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Cop Logic
Give address of logical copper list. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Multi Wait
Manage multi-tasking on the Amiga. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

AMOS To Front
Bring AMOS IDE in the front of display. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

AMOS To Back
Bring AMOS IDE in the back of display. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

AMOS Here
Detect if AMOS is running. Emulation returns TRUE

AMOS Lock
Blocks Amiga-A key. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Close Workbench
Cclose the Workbench. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Set Buffer
Set the size of the variable area. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Equ string
Get an equate. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Lvo
Get the Library Vector Offset. This instruction will not be implemented in AOZ.

Set Double Precision
Engage double precision accuracy. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Request WB
Use the Workbench system requester. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Request ON
Use the AMOS Professional requester routine. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Request OFF
Used to cancel the requester. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

NTSC
Test if the display is emulating a NTSC TV set.

Load Iff path$, index, *tags$
Load an IFF image into a screen (deprecated, use "Load Image")

Save Iff path$, index
Save an IFF image out of a screen (deprecated, use "Save Image")

PLoad path$, index
Load machine code directly into memory. This instruction will not be implemented in AOZ.

Mask Iff mask
Indicate what sections of an IFF file to load the next time the Load IFF instruction is used

Frame Load channel, bank, *length
Load frames of an IFF channel into memory

Frame Play bank, number, *screen
Play IFF frameson screen

IFF Anim path$, screen, *nFrames
Play IFF frameson screen

Frame Length channel, *nFrames
Indicates if a file or directory exists on the disc

Frame Skip bank, *nFrames
Skip past an animation frame

Frame Param
Return a parameter after playing a frame

Get Fonts
Scan the system for new fonts, will scan both Google and Amiga fonts.

Get Disc Fonts
Scan the system for Amiga fonts.

Get Rom Fonts
Scan the system for Google fonts.

Get CBlock index, X1, y1, x2, y2
Captures a portion of the graphics from a screen into a buffer. (deprecated, use Get Block)

Put CBlock index, x, y
Draw a previously capture block in the current screen. (deprecated, use Put Block)

Del CBlock index
Destroys an existing CBlock and free memory (deprecated, use Del Block)

Reserve As Chip Work index, length
Reserve and allocates memory for a new bank in Amiga chip memory, and add it to the list of banks (deprecated)

Reserve As Chip Data index, length
Reserve and allocates memory for a new bank of "Data" type in Amiga chip memory, and add it to the list of banks (deprecated)

Pack screen, bank, x1, y1, x2, y2
Compress an screen into a memory bank

SPack screen, bank, x1, y1, x2, y2
Compress an screen into a memory bank

Unpack bank, *x, *y, *screen
Unpack a compacted screen

Set Tempras buffer, integer
Set Temporary Raster

Icon Base iconIndex
Returns the address of the Icon whose number is specified in brackets. Not implemented in AOZ

Free
Return the amount of free memory on the machine.

Chip Free
Return the amount of free memory on the machine. Warnign, not tested and maybe deprecated in the future./ The original AMOS instruction reported the amount of free chip memory of the machine, which has no meaning tocay

Fast Free
Return the amount of free memory on the machine. Warnign, not tested and maybe deprecated in the future./ The original AMOS instruction reported the amount of free fast memory of the machine, which has no meaning tocay

Set Stack space
Deprecated, we used to set the stack space on the Amiga

Set Equate Bank bank
Deprecated, was used on the Amiga

Call Address, parameter
Deprecated, was used on the Amiga

ExeCall offset
Deprecated, was used on the Amiga

GfxCall offset
Deprecated, was used on the Amiga

DosCall offset
Deprecated, was used on the Amiga

IntCall offset
Deprecated, was used on the Amiga

Menu Base x, y
Move the starting position of a menu. Amiga only, This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Set Menu item, x, y
Move a menu item. Amiga only, This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu TLine level
Display menu items as a total horizontal bar. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Movable level
Activate automatic menu movement. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Static level
Stop automatic menu movement. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Item Static level
Fix items in static positions. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Item Movable level
Move individual menu options. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Active level
Activate a menu item. Will be implemented later.

Menu Separate level
Separate a list of menu items. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Link LEVEL
Link a list of menu items. Will be implemented later.

Menu Called level
Re-draw a menu item continually. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Menu Once level
Turn off automatic re-drawing. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

X Menu level
Return the graphical x-coordinate of a menu item. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Y Menu level
Return the graphical x-coordinate of a menu item. This instruction may be implemented in a future version of AOZ.

Screen Swap *index
Swaps the physical and logical buffers of a screen. (Deprecated in AOZ, legacy instruction, has no real effect)

Dual Playfield screen, screen2
Associate the display of two screens into a parallax display. (Deprecated, use "Set Transparent" and "Screen Offset" to associate more than two screens together)

Dual Priority screen1, screen2
Set the display priority of two screens associate in Dual Playfield. (Deprecated, use "Set Transparent" and "Screen Offset" to associate more than two screens together, and then "Screen To Front" or "Screen To Back" to handle the display priority)

Phybase index
Return the address of the first pixel in the bitmap buffer of the current screen (deprecated, there is no difference between logical and physical screen buffers in AOZ)

Logbase index
Return the address of the first pixel in the bitmap buffer of the current screen (deprecated, there is no difference between logical and physical screen buffers in AOZ)

Physic index
Return a magical number representing the physical buffer of the current screen, to be used in "Screen Copy" and all Screen instructions that necessitate a Screen Index. (deprecated, no such thing as physical or logic al screen in AOZ)

Logic index
Return a magical number representing the logical buffer of the current screen, to be used in "Screen Copy" and all Screen instructions that necessitate a Screen Index. (deprecated, no such thing as physical or logic al screen in AOZ)

Autoback index, mode
Set the autoback background preservation system for graphical instruction (Deprecated, has no effect in AOZ)

Screen Base
Not implemented, deprecated, will return 0

Hires
Return a magical number to be used in the "Screen Open" instruction, enforce a horizontal compression by half of the pixels

Lowres
Return a magical number to be used in the "Screen Open" instruction, display pixel with their original horizontal ratio

Laced
Return a magical number to be used in the "Screen Open" instruction, enforce a vertical compression by half of the pixels

Halfbright
Return a magical number to be used in the "Screen Open" instruction, and set the screen in Amiga-compatible Halfbright colour mode

X Hard *screen
Converts a horizontal coordinate in a given screen to its equivalent in hardware coordinates taking into account the position, scale and rotation factor of the screen

Y Hard *screen
Converts a vertical coordinate in the current screen to its equivalent in hardware coordinates taking into account the position, scale and rotation factor of the screen

Screen Mode
Return the "mode" parameter of a screen, as used in the "Screen Open" instruction

Double Buffer
Turns the display system into double-buffering. Deprecated

HZone *index, x, y
Check if a given hardware coordinate lay inside of a zone. Hardware coordinate are only different from screen coordinate for retro-machine emulation (Amiga, Atari etc.)

Sprite Base *index
Get Sprite table

Close Editor
Close the AMOS Professional Editor Window

Set Sprite Buffer
Set the height of hardware sprites

Anim channelIndex, definition$
Starts a simple animation

Anim Off channelIndex
Stops the animations of an animation channel

Anim On channelIndex
Starts the animations of an animation channel and eventually set the refresh frequency

Anim Freeze channelIndex
Pause the animations of an animation channel

Move index, definitionX$, definitionY$
Starts a simple movement horizontally and vertically. You must use "Move On" to actually see the object moving.

Move X channelIndex, definition$
Starts a simple movement horizontally. You must use "Move On" to actually see the object moving.

Move Y channelIndex, definition$
Starts a simple movement horizontally. You must use "Move On" to actually see the object moving.

Move Off *channelIndex
Stops the movement of an animation channel

Move On *channelIndex
Starts the movement of an animation channel

Move Freeze channelIndex
Pauses the movement of an animation channel

Movon channelIndex
Returns True if the animation channel is moving, false if not.

Synchro On
Turn ON the automatic execution of the animations and movements

Synchro Off
Turn OFF the automatic execution of the AMAL programs

Synchro
Executes on step of animation of all AMAL channels. "Synchro Off" must have been used before calling this instruction

Show HTML Index
Displays the HTML content loaded with the Load Asset statement.

HTML Element index, *ClassName$, *Content$, *Style$, *Focus, *Visible, *Enable, *Checked, *Value$, *OnFocus$, *OnBlur$, *OnClick$, *OnDoubleClick$, *OnMouseDown$, *OnMouseUp$, *OnMouseMove$, *OnMouseOver$, *OnMouseEnter$, *OnMouseOut$, *OnKeyPress$, *OnKeyDown$, *OnKeyUp$
Manipulation of a component of the HTML page

HTML Code$ Index
 returns the HTML code of an element

HTML Element Attribute Index, ATTRIBUTE$
 returns the attribute value of a HTML element

HTML Element Attribute# Index, ATTRIBUTE$
 returns the attribute value of a HTML element

HTML Element Attribute$ Index, ATTRIBUTE$
 returns the attribute value of a HTML element

Console Log text$
 Write a text in the JS Console

Console Error text$
 Write an error text in the JS Console

Console Warn text$
 Write a warn text in the JS Console

JS Execute javascript$
Executes the Javascript code defined in the parameter string..

Load Asset Listener onLoad$, onLoad$
Définit les procédures AOZ a appeler lors du chargement des Assets

Load Asset path$, index
Load an external file for Image, Audio, video or JSON. If the file is an image, it can be used with the "Bob" command.

Load Asset path$, index
Load an external file for Image, Audio, video or JSON. If the file is an image, it can be used with the "Bob" command.

Del Asset type$, index
Delete an asset from the memory.

JSON Asset Property index, path$
Get a numeric value from the JSON file loaded with the "Load Asset" command

JSON Asset Property$ index, path$
Get a string value from the JSON file loaded with the "Load Asset" command

Asset Loaded index, type$
Return True if an asset has been loaded with the "Load Asset" command, else False

Bank Swap bank1, bank2
Swap two banks in the list of banks

Bank Shrink bannkIndex, length
Change the size of a memory bank

Start bankIndex
Return the address of the start of a memory bank (composite number, only useable with AOZ mmemory instruction)

Length bankIndex
Return the length of a memory bank

Erase bankIndex
Destroy the content of a memory bank and remove it from the list of banks

Erase All
Destroy all memory banks

Erase Temp
Destroy all temporary memory banks (bank marked as "Work")

List Bank *bankIndex
Displays the list of one or all the memory banks in the current screen, type and length

Reserve As Work bankIndex, length
Reserve and allocates memory for a new bank of "Work" type, and add it to the list of banks

Reserve As Data bankIndex, length
Reserve and allocates memory for a new bank of "Data" type, and add it to the list of banks

Image Width imageIndex
Return the width in pixels of an image in the Images bank

Image Height imageIndex
Return the height in pixels of an image in the Images bank

Image DataURL$ imageIndex
Return a data URI containing a representation of an image in the Images bank. The returned image is in a resolution of 96 dpi.

HRev imageIndex
Return a flag of bits to be used in Bob and Sprite instructions that will mirror the image horizontally

VRev imageIndex
Return a flag of bits to be used in Bob and Sprite instructions that will mirror the image vertically

Rev imageIndex
Return a flag of bits to be used in Bob and Sprite instructions that will mirror the image horizontally and vertically

Ins Image position
Inserts an empty image in the Images bank

Ins Image start, end
Inserts a number of empty images in the Images bank

Del Image imageIndex
Delete an image in the Images bank

Del Image start, end
Delete a range of images from the image bank

Get Image *screenIndex, imageIndex, x1, y1, x2, y2, *tags$
Captures a portion of the current screen, create a transparency mask out of true black (RGB #000000) and add the image to the Images bank.

Make Mask imageIndex
Create a transparency mask out of the full black color of an image in the Images bank (RGB = $000000)

No Mask imageIndex
Removes the transparency mask of an image in the Images bank, turning the image full opaque

Hot Spot imageIndex, x, y
Set the hot-spot of an image in the Images bank

Hot Spot imageIndex, flags
Calculates the hot-spot of an image in the Images bank

Hot Spot imageIndex, direction$
Returns the coordinate of the hot-spot of an image in the Images bank

BGrab imageIndex
Grab a memory bank used by the previous program

BSend imageIndex
Transfer a memory bank from the current program to the previous program

=BStart imageIndex
Return the address of a memory bank from a previous program

Bob index, x, y, image
Changes the image of a bob

Bob Camera index, x, y
Creates or sets the point of view on a bob

Bob Off index
Destroys all or one bob

Bob Update Off
Turns off the automatic bob coordinate update system. After it, all "Bob" instruction will no longer have a visible effect until an "Bob Update" instruction is useD

Bob Update On
Turns on the automatic bob coordinate update system. After it, the effect of all "Bob" instructions will be visible on display without intervention on yoru part.

Bob Update
Performs one step of animation of all the bobs in all the screen and displays the result

Limit Bob X1, Y1, X2, Y2
Clip the position (but not the display) of all bobs to a limited area in the current screen

Paste Bob x, y, image, *scaleX#, *scaleY#, width, height
Draws an image from the image bank in the current screen

Bob Alpha index, alpha#
Set the global transparency of a bob, also called "Alpha"

Bob Show index
Make a bob visible on screen

Bob Hide index
Make a bob invisible

Bob Scale idnex, scaleX#, scaleY#
Changes the scale (zoom) of a bob

Bob Rotate index, angle#
Rotates a bob around it's hot-spot

Bob Skew index, skewX#, skewY#
Distorts a bob horizontally or vertically

Put Bob index
Draws the bob in in the current screen as a stamp, at its current position with it's current scale, rotation and skew

Bob Shadow index, offsetX, offsetY, blur, rgba
Display a shadow beneath the bob.

Bob Shadow Off index
Turns off one or all bob shadows by setting the offsets to zero.

Priority On
Turns on automatic sorting of the Z-order of the bobs in the current screen

Priority Off
Turns off automatic sorting of the Z-order of the bobs in the current screen

Priority Reverse On
Inverts the Z-Order of the bobs in the current screen if Priority is activated. After this instruction, bobs with the highest Y coordinate will be displayed in the back of others

Priority Reverse Off
Stops the inversion of the Z-Order of the bobs in the current screen if Priority is activated. After this instruction, bobs with the lowest Y coordinate will be displayed in the back of others

BobPriority onOff
Turns on or off automatic sorting of the Z-order of the bobs

X Bob
Returns the horizontal coordinate of the bob

Y Bob
Returns vertical coordinate of the bob

I Bob
Returns the index of the current image displayed by the bob

I Bob$
 Returns the name of the current image displayed by the bob as a string

IsBob
Checks if a bob is defined without generating an error

Get Bob *screenIndex, imageIndex, x1, y1, x2, y2, *tags$
Captures a portion of the current screen, create a transparency mask out of true black (RGB #000000) and add the image to the Images bank. (Deprecated, use "Get Image")

Ins Bob position
Inserts an empty image in the Images bank (deprecated, use "Ins Image")

Ins Bob start, end
Inserts a number of empty images in the Images bank (deprecated, use "Ins Image")

Del Bob imageIndex
Delete an image in the Images bank (deprecated, use "Del Image")

Bob Move index, movementX$, movementY$
Defines the movement of a bob horizontally and vertically.

Bob Move X index, movement$
Defines the horizontal movement of a bob. The bob starts to move immediately. For finer control please use the "Channel" and "MoveX" instructions.

Bob Move Y index, movement$
Defines the horizontal movement of a bob. The bob starts to move immediately. For finer control please use the "Channel" and "Move Y" instructions.

Bob Move Off index
Stops the movement of one or all the bobs.

Bob Move On index
Start the movement of one or all the bobs.

Bob Move Freeze index
Pause the movement of one or all the bobs.

Bob Moveon index
Indicates if the movement of one bob is completed or not.

Bob Filter index, filterName$, value1#, value2#, value3#, value4#
Set or add a graphical filter to a bob

Bob Filter Del index, filterName$
Remove a specific or all filters applied to a bob.

Filter$ index
Returns the CSS string used by Javascript in the context.filter property.

Filter index
Return the current value of the given filter

Bob Col index, index
Test if two bobs are in collision

Bob Col index, start, end
Test if one bob is colliding with a set of bobs

BobSprite Col index, index
Test if a bob is colliding with a sprite

BobSprite Col index, start, end
Test if one bob is colliding with a set of sprites

Sprite Col index, start, end
Test if two sprites are in collision

SpriteBob Col index, start, end
Test if a bob is colliding with a sprite

Col index
Test the status of an object after collision detection

Bob Collide With index, list
Indicate the category of bobs or sprites a bob collides with

Bob Collide index, with
Sets the collision categories of a bob

Bob Point index, x, y
Test if a point lays inside of a bob

Sprite Point index, x, y
Test if a point lays over a sprite

Get Palette index, mask
Grab the palette of another screen in the current screen

Get Images Palette mask
Copy the colour palette from the Images bank to the current screen

Colour Back number
Assign a colour to the screen background

Colour number, rgb
Set the RGB value of a colour in the palette the current screen

Color number, rgb
Set the RGB value of a colour in the palette the current screen

Colour number
Return the RGB value of a colour from the palette of the current screen

Color number
Return the RGB value of a colour from the palette of the current screen

RGB$ red, green, blue
Return a string with the given RGB colors

RGB$ color$
Return a string with the RGB values of a Javascript color

RGB res, green, blue
Return a number with the RGB value encoded

RGBA red, green, blue, alpha
Return a number with the RGBA value encoded

RGB color$
Return a number with the RGB value of a Javascript color encoded

Flash Off

Flash number, definition$

Shift Off

Shift Down delay, firstColor, lastColor, rotateFirstColor

Fade delay, screenIndex, mask
TODO! Blend the colours of the current screen to the values of the palette of another screen

Default
Restore the display to the state it was when the application start. Close all screen, all windows, detroys all bobs and sprites and open the default screen

Joy joystick
Return the current state of the joystick

JUp joystick, lock

 Return the brand name of the gamepad

 Return the vendor code for the specified gamepad

 Return the product code for the specified gamepad

Destroys the current screen or a given screen

Screen Clone index
Create an exact and synchronized copy of the current screen that can be displayed at another position and Z-order. Both screen share the same internal pixel buffers. Graphical operations are fobidden in the cloned screen

Make a screen disappear from display. The screen will remain active and drawing operation are still possible after this instruction

Make a hidden screen reappear on display

Set the offet in the internal screen buffer of the top-left diplayed pixel, allowing scrollings

Change the display order of the screen, and passes the screen behind all other screens

Screen Hot Spot index, xSpot, ySpot
Set the hot-spot of a screen to a given coordinate. The hot-spot is the position within the screen where the Screen Offset will have effect and around which rotation will be done

Set the hot spot of a screen to a given coordinate. The hot-spot is the position within the screen where the Screen Offset will have effect and around which rotation will be done

Set the global transparency of a Screen, also called "Alpha". All graphics, text and Bobs that are on the screen will be affected. Sprites are unaffected by Screen Alpha.

Set the Global Composite Operation of a Screen. This controls the way the screens pixels interact with underlying pixels as the screen is drawn. The instruction is in the experimental phase of development and functionality may change in the future.

Copy an area from one screen to another or itself, with optional resizing and/or re-shaping or warping the area

Y Screen *screenIndex, y

Make a sprite invisible

Sprite Off *index
Destroys all or one sprite

Turns on or off automatic sorting of the Z-order of the sprites

Turns off the automatic sprite coordinate update system. After it, all "Sprite" instruction will no longer have a visible effect until an "Sprite Update" instruction is used

Sprite Update On
Turns on the automatic sprite coordinate update system. After it, the effect of all "Sprite" instructions will be visible on display

Enforce a refresh of all the sprites on screen

Td Init
Initialization of the 3D engine to be called before any 3D command is used. An error is caused if a 3D command is called without having initialized the engine first.

Td View Index, *X, *Y, *Width, *Height, Scene, *Camera$, *Visible, *Enable, *Antialias, *UIScreen, *Effect$, *EffectParam$
To display a 3D scene you have to define a rectangular area of the screen, in which it will be displayed. The 3D engine automatically takes care of updating this view. It is possible to have several views on the screen, for example if you want to develop a multi-player 3D game.

Td Copy Index, Scene, *Name$
Creates an exact copy into the memory of a 3D object of the scene (parameters, material and textures) under a new index. The copy will be stored in memory and will can to use as an asset.

Add a copied 3D object (copied with the Td Copy instruction) in a 3D Scene under a new name.

Td Cls Index

Td Anim Scene, Clip$, *Object$, *Loop$

Td Camera Index, *Focal#, *Zooml#, *Near#, *Far#

Reserve Zone *number
Reserve memory to store graphical detection zones in the current screen

Reset Zone *index
Erase the definition of a zone, making it non-detectable

Zone$ text$, index
Return a magical string to use in the Print instruction when printing text, allowing you to define a zone around the text included as a parameter

Set Zone index, x1, y1, x2, y2
Define a new zone in the current screen

Zone index, x, y
Check if a given coordinate lays inside of a pre-defined zone

Mouse Zone
Return the index of a predefined zone (with "Set Zone") under the mouse

Zone On index
Enable a zone in the current screen

Zone Off index
Disable a zone in the current screen

Zones Length
Returns the number of zones defined for the current screen.

Zone Enabled index
Return True if the zone is enabled, or False
